pr.title: Production cleanup and code quality improvements
pr.body:
## Summary This PR prepares the codebase for production deployment by: - **Removing development artifacts**: Deleted `.foundation/`, `Next-Steps/`, `docs/`, and `FIXES_LOG.md` (12,700+ lines removed) - **Updating .gitignore**: Added comprehensive patterns for IDE files, OS artifacts, build cache, and temp files - **Fixing all ESLint issues**: Resolved 5 errors (unescaped entities) and 71 warnings (unused imports) - **Fixing TypeScript errors**: Restored accidentally removed imports in 3 files - **Adding documentation**: Created `README.md` with project docs and `CLAUDE.md` for AI assistant guidance ## Code Quality Verification | Check | Status | |-------|--------| | TypeScript (`tsc --noEmit`) | 0 errors | | ESLint (`npm run lint`) | 0 errors, 0 warnings | | Build (`npm run build`) | 77 pages generated | ## Files Changed - 87 files changed - 369 insertions, 12,702 deletions - Net reduction: ~12,300 lines (cleanup of dev artifacts) ## Test Plan - [x] Run `npx tsc --noEmit` - passes - [x] Run `npm run lint` - passes with 0 errors/warnings - [x] Run `npm run build` - 77 pages build successfully - [ ] Deploy to Vercel preview --- ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Documentation** * Added comprehensive developer guide with project architecture, coding standards, and quick references. * Updated project README with tech stack, features overview, and deployment guidance. * **Chores** * Removed outdated planning and internal documentation files. * Cleaned up unused imports and dependencies across multiple pages. * Expanded `.gitignore` for better build, testing, and environment handling.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR performs production readiness cleanup by removing development artifacts and fixing all linting issues. **Major Changes:** - **Documentation cleanup**: Removed 12,700+ lines of internal planning docs (`.foundation/`, `Next-Steps/`, `docs/`, `FIXES_LOG.md`) - **Code quality fixes**: Removed 71 unused imports and 5 unescaped entity warnings across 44 TypeScript files - **Enhanced .gitignore**: Added comprehensive patterns for IDE files, OS artifacts, build cache, secrets, and temp files - **New documentation**: Created `README.md` with project overview and `CLAUDE.md` for AI coding assistants **Code Changes:** - Removed unused imports (Badge, BarChart, DataTable, Platform type, etc.) from page components - Removed unused helper components (`ClickableMetricCard`) and constants (`priorityBadgeStyles`, `platformColors`) - Fixed unused variable warnings (e.g., `timeRange` ‚Üí `_` pattern in crisis-management/page.tsx) **Verification:** - TypeScript: 0 errors (`tsc --noEmit`) - ESLint: 0 errors, 0 warnings - Build: 77 pages generated successfully No breaking changes detected - all removals were genuinely unused code.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge - it only removes unused code and documentation - The PR exclusively removes development artifacts and unused code without modifying any runtime logic. All changes passed TypeScript compilation, ESLint, and production build verification. No functional code was altered. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

 | Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | .gitignore | Expanded with comprehensive patterns for IDE, OS, build, cache, temp files, and secrets | | README.md | Enhanced with tech stack details, project structure, features list, and deployment instructions | | CLAUDE.md | New AI assistant guide with architecture, coding standards, and component patterns | | src/app/(app)/dashboard/page.tsx | Removed unused imports (Badge, ChevronRight, Plus, FileText) and unused ClickableMetricCard component | | src/app/(app)/action-center/page.tsx | Removed unused priorityBadgeStyles constant, styles now used inline | | src/app/(app)/platforms/compare/page.tsx | Removed unused imports (BarChart, Platform type) and platformColors constant |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant ESLint as ESLint participant TSC as TypeScript Compiler participant Build as Next.js Build participant PR as Pull Request Dev->>Dev: Remove .foundation/, Next-Steps/, docs/ folders Dev->>Dev: Delete FIXES_LOG.md (dev artifact) Dev->>Dev: Update .gitignore with comprehensive patterns Dev->>ESLint: Run lint check ESLint-->>Dev: 5 errors + 71 warnings (unescaped entities, unused imports) Dev->>Dev: Fix unescaped entities in JSX Dev->>Dev: Remove unused imports from 44 .tsx files Dev->>Dev: Remove unused components/constants Dev->>ESLint: Run lint check again ESLint-->>Dev: ‚úÖ 0 errors, 0 warnings Dev->>TSC: Run type check (tsc --noEmit) TSC-->>Dev: ‚úÖ 0 errors Dev->>Dev: Create README.md with project docs Dev->>Dev: Create CLAUDE.md for AI assistance Dev->>Build: Run production build Build-->>Dev: ‚úÖ 77 pages generated successfully Dev->>PR: Create pull request PR-->>Dev: Ready for review (12,333 lines removed, 369 added) ```

Summary by Bito

This pull request prepares the codebase for production deployment through comprehensive cleanup and code quality improvements. It removes development artifacts including .foundation/, Next-Steps/, docs/, and FIXES_LOG.md directories, updates .gitignore with comprehensive patterns, fixes all ESLint issues by removing unused imports and correcting HTML entities, restores missing imports for TypeScript compliance, and adds documentation with README.md and CLAUDE.md. The code changes across 44 page components eliminate unused imports, constants, and variables while maintaining full functionality.

Detailed Changes
  • Removed unused imports from UI components, charts, and utilities across 44 page components in dashboard/page.tsx, action-center/page.tsx, and others, reducing bundle size and improving maintainability.
  • Fixed unescaped HTML entities in JSX strings (e.g., " to “ and ' to ') in tracking/page.tsx, billing/page.tsx, and settings pages to prevent rendering issues.
  • Removed unused constants, helper components, and variables (e.g., priorityBadgeStyles, ClickableMetricCard, platformColors) in action-center/page.tsx, dashboard/page.tsx, and platforms/compare/page.tsx to clean up code.
  • Updated .gitignore with comprehensive patterns for IDE files, OS artifacts, build cache, and temp files to improve build and environment management.
  • Added project documentation including README.md with tech stack and deployment guidance, and CLAUDE.md for AI assistant integration.

comments.author: bito-code-review
comments.rawBody:
Hardcoded Month Filter
The filter uses a hardcoded 'Feb' string, which will only correctly count February exports and may incorrectly include past February dates from other years. Use Date objects to accurately filter for the current month and year instead.
Code suggestion
Check the AI-generated fix before applying
````suggestion const now = new Date(); const currentMonth = now.getMonth(); const currentYear = now.getFullYear(); const thisMonth = exportHistory.filter((e) => { const exportDate = new Date(e.date); return exportDate.getMonth() === currentMonth && exportDate.getFullYear() === currentYear; }).length ````
Code Review Run #f933eb
--- Should Bito avoid suggestions like this for future reviews? (Manage Rules) - [ ] Yes, avoid them
comments.fix: The filter uses a hardcoded 'Feb' string, which will only correctly count February exports and may incorrectly include past February dates from other years. Use Date objects to accurately filter for the current month and year instead.

comments.author: bito-code-review
comments.rawBody:
Incomplete refactoring of export metrics
The variable `completedExports` was removed and replaced with `thisMonth`, but the logic changed from filtering by `status === "completed"` to filtering by `date.includes("Feb")`. This appears to be an incomplete refactoring. Consider verifying whether the intent was to track completed exports or exports from this month, as these represent different metrics.
Code suggestion
Check the AI-generated fix before applying
````suggestion export default function ExportsPage() { const completedExports = exportHistory.filter( (e) => e.status === "completed" ).length const thisMonth = exportHistory.filter((e) => e.date.includes("Feb") ).length ````
Suggested based on your custom review guideline "Only Report Important Things"
Code Review Run #f933eb
--- Should Bito avoid suggestions like this for future reviews? (Manage Rules) - [ ] Yes, avoid them
comments.fix: The variable `completedExports` was removed and replaced with `thisMonth`, but the logic changed from filtering by `status === "completed"` to filtering by `date.includes("Feb")`. This appears to be an incomplete refactoring. Consider verifying whether the intent was to track completed exports or exports from this month, as these represent different metrics.

comments.author: bito-code-review
comments.body:
**Percentage Display Inconsistency**

The warning text hardcodes '34.5%' but the displayed usage stat rounds to 35%, creating inconsistency. Consider calculating percentages with one decimal place and using the dynamic value in the warning.

general.body: Interaction Diagram by Bito ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant DashboardPage as DashboardPageüîÑ Updated | ‚óè‚óè‚óã Medium participant generatePlatformData participant MetricCard participant ScoreBadge participant TrendIndicator participant LineChart participant PageHeader participant TimeRangeSelector Note over DashboardPage: Removed clickable wrapper from KPI cardsNo navigation on card clicks User->>DashboardPage: Navigate to /dashboard DashboardPage->>generatePlatformData: Fetch platform data generatePlatformData-->>DashboardPage: Return data DashboardPage->>PageHeader: Render header PageHeader-->>DashboardPage: Header rendered DashboardPage->>TimeRangeSelector: Render time selector TimeRangeSelector-->>DashboardPage: Selector rendered DashboardPage->>MetricCard: Render KPI cards MetricCard-->>DashboardPage: Cards rendered DashboardPage->>ScoreBadge: Render score badges ScoreBadge-->>DashboardPage: Badges rendered DashboardPage->>TrendIndicator: Render trend indicators TrendIndicator-->>DashboardPage: Indicators rendered DashboardPage->>LineChart: Render visibility trend chart LineChart-->>DashboardPage: Chart rendered DashboardPage-->>User: Display complete dashboard ``` --- **Critical path:** User -> DashboardPage -> generatePlatformData -> MetricCard > **Note:** The MR removes the .foundation directory with internal documentation files and adds CLAUDE.md to provide guidance for AI coding assistants. It also cleans up unused imports across multiple page components and removes the clickable functionality from KPI cards on the dashboard, simplifying the user interface by eliminating direct navigation from metric cards. Key architectural layers include the entry point dashboard page, data transformation in generatePlatformData for mock data processing, and UI components like MetricCard for displaying KPIs. If the interaction diagram doesn't appear, refresh the page to render it. You can disable interaction diagrams by customizing agent settings. Refer to documentation.

src/app/(app)/reports/exports/page.tsx.rawBody:
Hardcoded Month Filter
The filter uses a hardcoded 'Feb' string, which will only correctly count February exports and may incorrectly include past February dates from other years. Use Date objects to accurately filter for the current month and year instead.
Code suggestion
Check the AI-generated fix before applying
````suggestion const now = new Date(); const currentMonth = now.getMonth(); const currentYear = now.getFullYear(); const thisMonth = exportHistory.filter((e) => { const exportDate = new Date(e.date); return exportDate.getMonth() === currentMonth && exportDate.getFullYear() === currentYear; }).length ````

src/app/(app)/reports/exports/page.tsx.rawBody:
Incomplete refactoring of export metrics
The variable `completedExports` was removed and replaced with `thisMonth`, but the logic changed from filtering by `status === "completed"` to filtering by `date.includes("Feb")`. This appears to be an incomplete refactoring. Consider verifying whether the intent was to track completed exports or exports from this month, as these represent different metrics.

bito-code-review.body:
**Percentage Display Inconsistency**

The warning text hardcodes '34.5%' but the displayed usage stat rounds to 35%, creating inconsistency. Consider calculating percentages with one decimal place and using the dynamic value in the warning.

bito-code-review.author: bito-code-review
bito-code-review.rawBody:
Hardcoded Month Filter
The filter uses a hardcoded 'Feb' string, which will only correctly count February exports and may incorrectly include past February dates from other years. Use Date objects to accurately filter for the current month and year instead.
Code suggestion
Check the AI-generated fix before applying
````suggestion const now = new Date(); const currentMonth = now.getMonth(); const currentYear = now.getFullYear(); const thisMonth = exportHistory.filter((e) => { const exportDate = new Date(e.date); return exportDate.getMonth() === currentMonth && exportDate.getFullYear() === currentYear; }).length ````
Code Review Run #f933eb

bito-code-review.author: bito-code-review
bito-code-review.rawBody:
Incomplete refactoring of export metrics
The variable `completedExports` was removed and replaced with `thisMonth`, but the logic changed from filtering by `status === "completed"` to filtering by `date.includes("Feb")`. This appears to be an incomplete refactoring. Consider verifying whether the intent was to track completed exports or exports from this month, as these represent different metrics.
Code suggestion
Check the AI-generated fix before applying
````suggestion export default function ExportsPage() { const completedExports = exportHistory.filter( (e) => e.status === "completed" ).length const thisMonth = exportHistory.filter((e) => e.date.includes("Feb") ).length ````
Suggested based on your custom review guideline "Only Report Important Things"
